Description: Heirloom is an app for sending messages into the future.

Full Description: I once asked my grandfather to write me a letter. In it, I wanted to know the following: What did he believe to be most important in life? If he could’ve gone back in time and spoken with his 20-year-old self, what would he say? Did he have any regrets? It was important for me to understand the world as he saw it; to learn from his successes, his mistakes, and potentially save myself from making some of my own. I wanted to see life through his eyes, if only for a moment. I wanted to capture his words — his memories. I wanted to remember his stories as if they were my own to share, and help them live on from generation to generation. Unfortunately, I never received that letter. The wisdom I had so longed to capture from my grandfather passed away alongside him. Years later, leading up to my wedding day, I requested the same of other elders in my family, hoping to make up for prior opportunities lost. But again, I was left letter-less. It was around this time that the idea for Heirloom first came to mind. With all of the technology and connectivity available to us in the world, there had to be an easier, more formalized way of documenting the experiences of our loved ones. There had to be an easier way of preserving and sharing their words long after their physical time in this world had come and gone. And now, there is. It’s easy to attach value to things; to want for nothing, buy just about any product you can imagine from the comfort of your couch, and feel instantly gratified. But the most valuable asset available to you in this world is knowledge. Pass it on.

Description: Your memories in the cloud, powered by voice
Headquarters Regions: Greater New York Area, East Coast, Northeastern US
Full Description: Vision: Memory Lane reminds users of their lives and histories by using voice computing to experience popular and personal memories stored in the cloud. Mission: Memories make us who we are. As we age, we collect billions of bits of memories. Sometimes, our physical and mental health causes us to lose sight of our memories which causes us to forget who we are. Thanks to easy to use technology like voice computing, we can now access our memories easily, reminding us of the great lives we led and sharing them with the younger generations to come.  Objectives: We empower active aging and longevity using software on voice computing platforms like Amazon’s Alexa to deliver reminiscence therapy. Our application Memory Lane is available for free on the Alexa skill store and uses historic audio clips to take visitors to any year from 1906 to present day. These recordings spark memories about what happened in the user’s life within a given year. Version 2 of Memory Lane will sync to a web interface to enable creation of unique personal memories uploaded by the individual (as a digital diary) or by loved ones who share reminiscences. Strategy: We are enabling voice computing in every room in every senior care facility in America. We can do this by creating a management system for voice computing devices and A.I. applications that provide customize experiences for aging individuals. Caregivers will have the ability to conduct daily tasks with greater ease, set up scheduling tasks and engage in activities. Our flagship product, Memory Lane, is ideal to help bring families closer together around the memories of the aging individual and be used in existing memory care programs throughout the country. Action Plans: We are working with four large organizations in New York and Vermont to pilot the use of Alexa in daily operations and host Memory Lane workshops to keep care-recipients engaged with each other, their caregivers, friends, and families. Our pilot will focus on feedback from caregivers, cognitively healthy seniors, those with early dementia, and then those with dementia.  In 2017, we will develop Memory Lane V2 with subscription and also develop for Google Assistant. We will continue to curate and expand the public Memory Lane library. We are establishing partnerships to run pilot studies in senior assisted living and memory care facilities. We are raising funds to pay our coders and complete our research study on Alexa & aging.
